meanings.definition: One who creates a written, printed, or electronic record of information.
meanings.sent1: The documenter carefully wrote down all the important details in the report.
meanings.sent2: The office documenter keeps track of all the files and paperwork.
meanings.sent3: The documenter accidentally spilled coffee on the important document, creating a coffee-stained masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: She was like a human documenter, capturing every moment of the event with her camera.
meanings.sent5: The documenter's meticulous notes made it easy to find any information quickly.

meanings.sent1: I need to documenter all the expenses for this project to stay organized.
meanings.sent2: She likes to documenter her travels by keeping a journal of each day's adventures.
meanings.sent3: He decided to documenter his daily routine in a humorous video series.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a camera, able to documenter every moment with perfect clarity.
meanings.sent5: The scientist wanted to documenter the rare bird species before they disappeared.
